paper_abstract: For a graph Gamma, subgroups M < G <= Aut(Gamma), and an edge partition E of Gamma, the pair (Gamma, E) is a (G, M)- homogeneous factorisation if M is vertex-transitive on Gamma and fixes setwise each part of E, while G permutes the parts of E transitively. A classification is given of all homogeneous factorisations of finite Johnson graphs. There are three infinite families and nine sporadic examples.
